posts._title: Gennadiy Vasilev – Finist – Yasnyy sokol AKA Finest, the Brave Falcon (1975)
posts.title: Finist – Yasnyy sokol
posts.excerpt: This fairy tale film is dedicated to the memory of the great film director Alexander Row, the founder of the genre. Once upon a time there lived a brave and kind hero named Finist the Bright Falcon. He was famous for his strength, courage and a heart of gold. But one day the Russian land …

posts.title: Storm Warning
posts.excerpt: Quote:Marsha Mitchell, a traveling dress model, stops in a southern town to see her sister who has married a Ku Klux Klansman. Marsha sees the KKK commit a murder and helps District Attorney Burt Rainey in bringing the criminals to justice.

posts._title: Akio Jissoji – Akutoku no sakae aka Marquis de Sade’s Prosperities of Vice [+Extras] (1988)
posts.title: Akutoku no sakae
posts.excerpt: Synopsis :A decadent Count in 1920’s Japan becomes obsessed with the works of the Marquis de Sade. He creates a theatre to show plays adapted from the notorious writers novels, and recruits a variety of theives, prostitutes and low lives to act out his fantasies on stage for the delight of his rich and decadent …
posts.titleEnglish: Marquis de Sade’s Prosperities of Vice

posts._title: Werner Herzog – Nomad: In the Footsteps of Bruce Chatwin (2019)
posts.title: Nomad: In the Footsteps of Bruce Chatwin
posts.excerpt: Channel BBC TwoNomad: In the Footsteps of Bruce Chatwin (21 Sept 2019) When legendary writer and adventurer Bruce Chatwin was dying of Aids, his friend and collaborator Werner Herzog made a final visit to say farewell. As a parting gift, Chatwin gave Herzog the rucksack that had accompanied him around the world.Thirty years later, carrying …

posts.title: The Strange Door
posts.excerpt: Noble-born cad Denis (Stapley) has been tricked into a forced stay at the eerie manor of the Sire de Maletroit (Laughton), an evil madman who can’t get over the death of his beloved, twenty years after she married his brother (Cavanagh) instead and subsequently passed away during childbirth. Maletroit is determined to have his revenge: …

posts.title: Man Hunt
posts.excerpt: Synopsis:British hunter Thorndike vacationing in Bavaria has Hitler in his gun sight. He is captured, beaten, left for dead, and escapes back to London where he is hounded by German agents and aided by a young woman.

posts._title: Zoran Tadic – Ritam Zlocina AKA Rhythm Of Crime (1981)
posts.title: Ritam Zlocina
posts.excerpt: A single teacher allows a stranger to share his home with him before it is to be torn down by developers. The stranger has a fascination with statistics and claims he can predict crimes based on statistical analyses. Intrigued by this talent, the teacher tells a married, female friend that the man seems to have …

posts.title: The Big Night
posts.excerpt: A film noir treatise about the coming of age of a young man is beautifully realized by the great Joseph Losey. John Drew Barrymore zigzags through the sordid vortex of downtown Los Angeles while seeking vengeance on the man who beat his Father. This superbly crafted “trial by fire” tale with memorable dialogue and shaded …

posts._title: Julian Radlmaier – Ein Gespenst geht um in Europa AKA A Spectre Is Haunting Europe (2013)
posts.title: Ein Gespenst geht um in Europa
posts.excerpt: Quote:Berlin, a summer in the age of neoliberalism: the spectre of the soviet avant-garde is haunting the city. A young Georgian contract-worker is surprised to find the ghost of the Russian revolutionary poet Vladimir Mayakovsky in his kitchen. At the same time, his friend Kasimir inherits a big fortune, but what shall he do with …

posts.title: Conspirator
posts.excerpt: London, 1949. A young American beauty, Melinda Greyton, flighty and immature, falls in love with a dashing but solitary and lonely English major, Michael Curragh, and he with her. His aged aunt, his only family, urges him to marry her, and he does. The trouble is, he’s an agent for the Soviets. His control is …
